definition[0]: to quickly follow someone or something in order to catch them
example[0]: The dogs saw him running and chased him.
example[2]: The police chased the suspect along Severn Avenue.
example[3]: A gang of boys chased after her, calling her names.
definition[1]: to make someone or something leave, especially by following them for a short distance and threatening them
example[4]: The men were chased off by troops, who fired warning shots.
example[5]: Anne went to chase the dog out of the garden.
definition[2]: to use a lot of time and effort trying to get something such as work or money
example[6]: Top graduates from the university are chased by major companies.
example[8]: I was chasing around getting everything organized.
definition[4]: to try hard to make someone notice you and pay attention to you, because you want to have a romantic relationship with them
example[9]: ‘Sometimes a girl wants to be chased, ’ Amelia said.
definition[5]: to decorate metal with a special tool
definition[6]: the act of following someone or something quickly in order to catch them
example[12]: Police spotted the car and gave chase (=chased it).
definition[7]: when you use a lot of time and effort trying to get something
definition[8]: a large bank in the US, with its main offices in New York City. It was formerly called the Chase Manhattan Bank, and merged with JP Morgan in 2000.
